“Care is not a luxury. It is infrastructure.”
— Millicent Periwinkle, Founder & Chief Cork Officer

In 1991, a twelve-year-old girl walked into the Topeka DMV and saw a beige wall with one crooked flyer about seatbelt safety. That wall told her everything she needed to know about how her government felt about her presence: not much. Three decades later, I have made it my life's work to ensure no citizen ever stares at a wall that says "we stopped trying." CorkyBoard.Biz transforms dead wall space into organized, intentional, human-facing displays that tell every visitor: we knew you were coming, and we prepared.

I once drove four hours to re-pin a single flyer. I am not exaggerating.
